itemDescription: Irish recipient of the Victoria Cross, born 1837

wikipedia_page.main: John Murray (February 1837 – 7 November 1911) was a British Army soldier and an Irish recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: Born in Birr, County Offaly, Sgt John Murray was approximately 27 years old during the Waikato-Hauhau Maori War, New Zealand.
